EmpiNull 1.0.0
  • Reference

Estimate Individualized Empirical Null Parameters for Poisson Outcomes

empirical_null_ind_CF_pois.Rd

Estimates parameters for an individualized empirical null model that accounts for confounding factors (x_bar), tailored for data with a Poisson Outcomes. The function estimates the confounder coefficients (zeta), a variance component (phi), and a null proportion (p0).

Usage

empirical_null_ind_CF_pois(
  z,
  E,
  E_2,
  x_bar,
  p_grid = seq(0.8, 0.999, 0.005),
  phi_grid = seq(0.01, 5, 0.01),
  cutoff = 0.95,
  sigma_est,
  range
)

Arguments

z

A numeric vector of Z-scores.

E

A numeric vector, where \(E_i = \sum_j \exp(X_{ij}^T \beta)\).

E_2

A numeric vector, where \(E_i^{(2)} = \sum_j \exp(X_{ij}^T \beta)^2\).

x_bar

A numeric matrix or vector of confounders. Each row corresponds to an observation in z.

p_grid

A numeric vector specifying the grid of null proportions (p0) to search. Defaults to a sequence from 0.8 to 0.999.

phi_grid

A numeric vector specifying the grid of the variance component (phi) to search. Defaults to a sequence from 0.01 to 5.

cutoff

A numeric value specifying the quantile for the truncation interval width. Defaults to 0.95.

sigma_est

Optional. A pre-estimated standard deviation. If provided, it defines a uniform width for the truncation interval.

range

Optional. A parameter to define a sample-size-dependent width for the truncation interval. Takes precedence over sigma_est.

Value

A list containing the final estimated parameters:

zeta

A numeric vector containing the estimated coefficients for the confounders in x_bar.

phi

The estimated variance component phi. Note: this is the raw phi, not its square root.

p0

The estimated null proportion p0.
